result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb Seay-Ali was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Attempted Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs. Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  DOC to collect fro 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any amount remaning due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC/August 14, 2014, Judge Jeffrey Wagner/Defendant convicted of Felony Murder (940.03) & Attempted Armed Robbery (939.32) PTAC***
**9/12/2014  Corrected Per Order signed on 9/12/2014.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor;  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (16 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 05-23-2014 received and filed.
Per Order Correcting Judgment of Conviction signed on 9/12/2014.

Order CORRECTING Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
The judgment shall be corrected to reflect that the defendant was convicted of felony murder under section 940.03, Stats., while attempting to commit armed robbery, party to a crime, under sections 943.32(2) and 939.05, Stats.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to correct JOC.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
The Clerk's office shall amend the judgment of conviction to state that the defendant is convicted of felony murder-attempted armed robbery, party to a crime.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request for amended JOC.

Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made. Correction to penalty section of PSI placed on record. Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 99 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments, victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Pay restitution of $350.00 to Beer Capitol Distributing, joint and several with Mark Washington 14CF624.
FAILURE TO PAY COSTS ASSESSMENTS SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.

Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon motion of the state, the Court will amend the Information to reflect ".....while committing an ATTEMPTED armed robbery..." adding statute 939.32.
To the charged offense:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court orders a PSI and remands the defendant.  Case is adjourned to 5-23-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing in Branch 38.

Atty Richard Johnson is requesting a plea date as soon as possible.
Plea set for 4-9-2014 at 8:15am.  ADA Mark Williams advised of date.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Caleb Seay-Ali not in court, in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 5-23-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-16-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-21-2014.  ls
Subpoena

Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in custody.  Grant Huebner for Mark Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Caleb Seay-Ali in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
